item.title: 高盛寻求购买香港建筑商新世界的部分贷款
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）寻求以折扣价购买新世界发展有限公司（New World Development Co.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has sought to purchase a portion of New World Development Co.’s loans at a discount, an indication of how one potential investor would value the debt of a builder that’s become a poster child of Hong Kong’s property woes.】

item.title: 更广泛的风险偏好减弱，铜随基本金属回落
item.description: 随着大盘转入风险厌恶基调，铜价下跌，股市也因对技术估值的担忧而下跌。【原文：Copper fell as broader markets shifted to a risk-off tone, with stocks dropping on concern over technology valuations.】

item.title: 报道称核反应堆将于 1 月重启，日本电力公司股价大涨
item.description: 有报道称，东京电力公司计划在 1 月份重启日本最大的核电站，该公司股价随之大涨 3%。【原文：Shares of Tokyo Electric Power Co. jumped as much as 3%, following reports that the utility is aiming to restart Japan’s largest nuclear power plant in January.】

item.title: 三色公司的 Excel 人员未能修正涉嫌欺诈案中的所有数字
item.description: 朱丹尼尔认为，这是 "他听过的最愚蠢的事情"。【原文：It was, according to Daniel Chu, “the stupidest f—-ing thing [he had] ever heard.”】

item.title: 本田将停止在日本和中国的生产，芯片短缺问题依然存在
item.description: 本田汽车公司将在未来几周内停止在日本和中国工厂的生产，这凸显了全球芯片短缺所带来的持续影响。【原文：Honda Motor Co. will halt production at plants in Japan and China in coming weeks, highlighting the lingering fallout of the global chip shortage.】

item.title: 面对日本更严格的规定，苹果修改 iOS 软件
item.description: 苹果公司正在对其在日本的 iOS 软件进行修改，以符合当地一项旨在促进竞争的新法律，这也是这家 iPhone 制造商为适应全球法规而做出的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：Apple Inc. is making changes to its iOS software in Japan to comply with a new local law aimed at fostering competition, part of broader efforts by the iPhone maker to adapt to regulations around the world.】

item.title: 印度人工智能股票暴涨 55000%，创世界纪录，引发泡沫担忧
item.description: 这只全球表现最好的股票正在成为投资者从人工智能热潮中追逐超额回报的警示故事。【原文：The world’s best-performing stock is turning into a cautionary tale for investors chasing outsized returns from the artificial-intelligence boom.】

item.title: 朝日因收购帝亚吉欧东非公司多数股权而下跌
item.description: 朝日集团控股有限公司（Asahi Group Holdings Ltd.）的股价创下一年多来的最大跌幅，原因是人们担心该公司斥资 23 亿美元收购东非啤酒有限公司（East African Breweries Ltd.）多数股权的交易定价过高，可能会推迟该日本公司的股票回购。【原文：Shares of Asahi Group Holdings Ltd. fell the most in over a year, amid concerns that its $2.3 billion deal for a majority stake in East African Breweries Ltd. was overpriced and may postpone the Japanese company’s share buyback.】

item.title: 万科在短短几天内与面临违约威胁的债券持有人会面
item.description: 中国万科集团公司将于周四与该公司试图推迟偿付的一笔债券的持有者会面，此时距离宽限期结束只有四天时间，如果不能达成协议争取更多时间，就可能触发一度难以想象的违约。【原文：China Vanke Co. will meet Thursday with holders of a bond it’s trying to delay paying, with only four days until a grace period ends that could trigger a once-unthinkable default in the absence of an agreement to buy more time.】

item.title: 报告称，OpenAI 曾讨论以 7500 亿美元的价值进行融资
item.description: 据《信息报》报道，OpenAI 已经与投资者进行了融资谈判，希望以 7500 亿美元的估值筹集数百亿美元。【原文：OpenAI has held funding talks with investors to raise tens of billions of dollars at a valuation of $750 billion, according to a report in the Information.】

item.title: 内部人士称，费米数据中心的潜在租户是亚马逊
item.description: 据 Business Insider 周三报道，亚马逊公司退出了费米公司（Fermi Inc.【原文：Amazon.com Inc. pulled out of talks to be the first tenant for Fermi Inc.’s massive artificial intelligence data center facility in West Texas, Business Insider reported Wednesday.】

item.title: 利率攀升，日本 JGB 零售销售额创 2007 年以来新高
item.description: 在日本央行开始收紧政策后，利率上升吸引家庭现金从银行存款中流出，今年面向个人投资者的日本政府债券销售额已超过 5 万亿日元（320 亿美元），创下 2007 年以来的最高纪录。【原文：Sales of Japan’s government bonds for individual investors have surged past ¥5 trillion ($32 billion) this year, the most since 2007, as rising interest rates draw household cash out of bank deposits after the Bank of Japan began tightening policy.】

item.title: 决策指南：通胀下降后英国央行将恢复降息
item.description: 英国央行很可能在周四进行圣诞节前的降息，因为人们对英国经济和就业市场的担忧已经从通胀转移到了挣扎中的经济和就业市场。【原文：The Bank of England will likely deliver a pre-Christmas interest-rate cut on Thursday as concerns shift away from inflation and toward the UK’s struggling economy and jobs market.】

item.title: 新加坡债券摆脱国债影响，避险需求增加
item.description: 新加坡主权债券对国债的敏感度有所下降，这表明投资者正在寻找美元资产的替代品。【原文：Singapore sovereign-bond sensitivity to Treasuries has declined, an indication that investors are looking for alternatives to dollar assets.】

item.title: 加纳在对计划进行第五次审查后释放了国际货币基金组织的 3.85 亿美元资金
item.description: 在成功审查其扩大信贷机制计划之后，加纳从国际货币基金组织获得了 3.85 亿美元的付款。【原文：Ghana has unlocked $385 million disbursement from the International Monetary Fund, following a successful review of its extended credit facility program.】

item.title: 石油上涨，委内瑞拉封锁、俄罗斯制裁成焦点
item.description: 由于投资者权衡了从委内瑞拉到俄罗斯的地缘政治风险，以及依然严峻的供应前景，石油从四年半低点反弹后延续涨势。【原文：Oil extended gains after bouncing off a four-and-a-half-year low, as investors weighed geopolitical risks from Venezuela to Russia against a still-bearish supply outlook.】

item.title: 波动性上升，日本交易所将提高日本国债期货流动性
item.description: 大阪交易所（Osaka Exchange Inc）正在考虑进行改革，以促进外国投资者参与其 20 年期日本国债期货交易，因为全球第三大债务市场的剧烈波动促使该合约的交易量达到创纪录的水平。【原文：Osaka Exchange Inc. is considering changes aimed at boosting foreign participation in its 20-year Japanese government bond futures, as surging volatility in the world’s third-largest debt market drives trading in the contracts to record levels.】

item.title: 人工智能和企业改革影响亚洲投资者的 2026 年贸易选择
item.description: 资金经理和分析师表示，随着全球贸易紧张局势的缓解，亚洲的政策改革和国内经济基本面将在明年的投资决策中发挥更大的作用。【原文：As global trade tensions ease, Asia’s policy reforms and domestic economic fundamentals will play a bigger role in investment decisions next year, money managers and analysts said.】

item.title: 交易员关注美国数据和委内瑞拉局势，黄金持稳于纪录高位附近
item.description: 由于投资者追踪委内瑞拉日益加剧的紧张局势并等待美国通胀数据，黄金在纪录高位附近企稳。【原文：Gold steadied near a record high, as investors tracked mounting tensions in Venezuela and waited for US inflation data.】

item.title: 澳大利亚债务管理机构因收入增加而削减发行目标
item.description: 在政府预测经济增长改善将带来更多收入后，澳大利亚债务管理机构削减了截至 2026 年 6 月的财政年度的债券发行计划，削减幅度超过预期。【原文：Australia’s debt manager has cut its bond issuance plans for the fiscal year ending June 2026 more than expected, after the government forecasted stronger revenue from improved economic growth.】

item.title: 日本 MBO 中激进主义者的反击推动出价提高和股票上涨
item.description: 激进基金越来越多地扰乱日本的私有化进程，推动为少数投资者提供更好的保护，并因其压力导致更高的出价和还价而推高股价。【原文：Activist funds are increasingly disrupting Japanese privatizations, pushing for better protection of minority investors and driving up share prices as their pressure leads to higher bids and counteroffers.】

item.title: 人民币反弹难以缓解中国股市增长困境
item.description: 由于对经济疲软和估值上升的担忧日益加剧，股市情绪低迷，人民币近期走强对中国股市的提振作用甚微。【原文：The yuan’s recent strength is doing little to boost Chinese stocks as mounting concerns over economic weakness and rising valuations sap sentiment toward equities.】

item.title: 中国不断增长的长期债务将加深定价压力
item.description: 中国正在发行更多期限较长的主权债务，以确保融资，但供应的增加有可能推高收益率，并对本已疲软的需求造成压力。【原文：China is issuing a greater proportion of longer-maturity sovereign debt to secure financing, but the increase in supply risks pushing up yields and weighing on already-weakening demand.】

item.title: 台湾预计将维持关键利率不变，经济因人工智能狂潮而蓬勃发展
item.description: 台湾可能将连续第七个季度维持政策利率不变，这是自2021年以来最长的一段时期。【原文：Taiwan will likely hold its policy rate for the seventh straight quarter — the longest stretch since 2021 — as the economy booms on global demand from AI developers for its tech products.】

item.title: 以色列前总理的电话联系方式和聊天记录在网上泄露
item.description: 以色列安全官员正在调查前总理纳夫塔利-贝内特（Naftali Bennett）备受瞩目的手机通讯录、照片和信息是如何泄露到网上的。【原文：Israeli security officials are investigating how the high-profile phone contacts, photos and messages belonging to former Prime Minister Naftali Bennett leaked online.】

item.title: 特朗普官员表示支持与加拿大和墨西哥达成贸易协议
item.description: 美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）表示，他支持美国继续与加拿大和墨西哥保持贸易协议，但在与立法者的闭门简报中承认，与这两个国家的问题依然存在。【原文：US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer indicated that he supports keeping the US in the trade accord with Canada and Mexico, acknowledging in closed-door briefings with lawmakers that issues with both nations remain.】

item.title: MoonPay 称 CFTC 的 Caroline Pham 将加入加密货币支付公司
item.description: MoonPay 公司表示，商品期货交易委员会代理主席卡罗琳-范（Caroline Pham）将加入这家加密支付公司，担任首席法务官。【原文：MoonPay Inc. said Caroline Pham, the acting chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, will join the crypto payments firm as its chief legal officer.】

item.title: 亚洲股市下跌，交易员从科技股撤退：市场综述
item.description: 由于全球市场陷入熟悉的风险厌恶模式，科技股和比特币受到科技股担忧的拖累，支持短期国债和贵金属，亚洲股市早盘下跌。【原文：Asian stocks were headed for early declines as global markets fell into a familiar, risk-off pattern with tech concerns weighing on stocks and Bitcoin, supporting short-dated Treasuries and precious metals.】

item.title: DoorDash 将杂货购物引入 ChatGPT，与 Instacart 竞争
item.description: 作为与 OpenAI 计划合作的一部分，DoorDash 公司将在 ChatGPT 中推出杂货购物功能，而就在一周前，竞争对手 Instacart 也宣布推出类似工具。【原文：DoorDash Inc. is launching a grocery shopping feature within ChatGPT as part of a planned partnership with OpenAI, just a week after rival Instacart announced a similar tool.】

item.title: 新西兰第三季度经济增长 1.1%，利率下降
item.description: 新西兰经济在第三季度的反弹幅度超过了经济学家的预测，在经历了第二季度的萎缩之后，利率下降有助于推动经济产出。【原文：New Zealand’s economy rebounded more than economists forecast in the third quarter, with falling interest rates helping drive output after a second-quarter contraction.】
